oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hallmarks of Country Music - Barbara Fairchild and Rex Allen Jr.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview of Barbara Fairchild (musician) and Rex Allen Jr. (musician). The interview is hosted by Rick Phillips (army sergeant/ radio host) for the Hallmarks of Country Music segment. The tape was recorded on an unidentified date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Barbara Fairchild; Rex Allen Jr.; Rick Phillips
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Promotion for Hallmarks of Country Music featuring Rick Phillips introducing Barbara Fairchild and Rex Allen Jr. -- (00:49) Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips introduction voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (01:28) Phillips performs a commercial spot about voting information -- (02:02) Bob Newhart performs an American Cancer Society commercial spot -- (02:58) Baby Doll (Barbara Fairchild) -- (05:01) Phillips introduces Fairchild who reflects on working with her new child -- (08:28) Teddy Bear (Barbara Fairchild) -- (10:28) Phillips performs a Veteran's Association home loan commercial spot -- (10:55) Thanks For the Memories (Barbara Fairchild) -- (13:07) Phillips inquires about Fairchild's impression of ""Thanks For the Memories,"" and both reflect on ""Standing in Your Line"" -- (15:43) Standing in Your Line (Barbara Fairchild) -- (17:52) Cal Smith reflects on his time as a military chef -- (18:26) Fairchild reflects on her time as an artist who performed for the troops -- (22:34) Little Girl Feeling (Barbara Fairchild) -- (25:10) Phillips performs a Project Ahead radio spot -- (25:57) Fairchild reflects on how everyone believes she is from St. Louis, and Phillips inquires where Fairchild's country roots came from -- (29:04) Kid Stuff (Barbara Fairchild) -- (31:29) Shoplifting commercial spot hosted by an unidentified duo -- (32:29) Never Coming Back Again (Rex Allen Jr.) -- (34:53) Phillips and Allen reflect on Allen's father; additionally, Allen reflects on how he changed his styling to country while in the military -- (39:19) Great Mail Robbery (Rex Allen Jr.) -- (42:07) Tips Magazine radio spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (42:57) Goodbye (Rex Allen Jr.) -- (45:13) Phillips introduces Allen to reflect on the success of ""Goodbye,"" and Phillips inquires about Allen's father's opinion on the state of country music -- (47:09) I Can See Clearly Now (Rex Allen Jr.) -- (48:45) Health careers commercial spot hosted by an unidentified voice -- (49:40) Another Goodbye Song (Rex Allen Jr.) -- (51:05) Phillips has Allen reflect on how ""Another Goodbye Song"" was written for Allen; additionally, both reflect on Allen's wife and say goodbye -- (53:38) Hallmarks outro tune [featuring Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (55:42) Phillips introduces next week's guest: Lynn Anderson -- (55:56) Top of the World (Lynn Anderson) -- (58:34) Anderson reveals she heard ""Top of the World"" and re-recorded it -- (59:43) Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips introduction voiceover] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Insert is of program information. The insert features time stamps.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Fairchild, Barbara, 1951-; Allen, Rex, 1947-; Phillips,Rick;
